title.narrative: HIV MAL & TB NFM3 BENGUELA CUA

description.narrative: The Project seeks to establish a robust integrated HIV/Malaria and TB system and response in the provinces of Benguela and Cuanza Sul, while ensuring that the approaches adopted are compatible with the national health system.

participating-org.narrative: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Tuberculosis V - TB/HIV-6??? Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment VI - TCP-1??? Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases VII - TCP-2??? Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities X - SPI-1 Proportion of pregnant women attending antenatal clinics who received three or more doses of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria

IV - TCS-1.1??? Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period - 93.300 / 340.000 = 27,44% (2019)

Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases - 13.613 (2019) VII - TCP-2??? Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities - 965.543 / 1.093.124 = 88,33% X - SPI-1 Proportion of pregnant women attending antenatal clinics who received three or more doses of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria - 221.954 / 1.018.055 = 21,80% (2019)

IV - TCS-Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period - 126.350 / 361.000 = 35,00%.

HIV I - PMTCT-2.1 Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery - 16.2% (702 / 4,346) II - KP-1a Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services - 16.48% (1,188 / 7,210) III - YP-1b Percentage of young people aged 10–24 years reached by comprehensive sexuality education and/or life skills–based HIV education out of schools - 2.9% (10,053 / 350,140) IV - TCS-Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period - 41.8% (150,750 / 361,000)
Tuberculosis V - TB/HIV-6⁽ᴹ⁾ Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment - 11.8% (35 / 296) VI - TCP-1⁽ᴹ⁾ Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases - 82.4% (6,434 / 7,808) VII - TCP-2⁽ᴹ⁾ Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus - treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases - 88.2% (6,142 / 6,963)
Malaria VIII - CM-1a⁽ᴹ⁾ Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities - 92.7% (1,049,380 / 1,132,386) IX - CM-2a⁽ᴹ⁾ Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities - 56.3% (318,741 / 566,525) X - SPI-1 Proportion of pregnant women attending antenatal clinics who received three or more doses of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria - 33.6% (26,832 / 79,927)

I - PMTCT-2.1 Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery - 28.5% (1,239 / 4,346) II - KP-1a Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services - 15% (1,082 / 7,210) III - YP-1b Percentage of young people aged 10–24 years reached by comprehensive sexuality education and/or life skills–based HIV education out of schools - 7.0% (24,510 / 350,140) IV - TCS-Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period - 40% (144,400 / 361,000)
Tuberculosis V - TB/HIV-6⁽ᴹ⁾ Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment - 495 (80%) out of 619 VI - TCP-1⁽ᴹ⁾ Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases - 7,808 VII - TCP-2⁽ᴹ⁾ Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus - treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases - 75.0% (5,105 / 6,807)
Malaria VIII - CM-1a⁽ᴹ⁾ Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities - 100% IX - CM-2a⁽ᴹ⁾ Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities – 95% X - SPI-1 Proportion of pregnant women attending antenatal clinics who received three or more doses of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria - 40% (52,296 / 130,739).
Results will be available in December 2022.
